description.plain:
Majid Jordan is an electronic-PBR&B duo formed in 2012 in Toronto, Canada, consisting of singer Majid Al Maskati and producer Jordan Ullman. Their music combines romantic R&B melodies with dance-able electronic beats.

Majid (originally from Bahrain) and Jordan (a Toronto native) met at the University of Toronto in 2011. They worked together under the stage name “Good People” and released the Soundcloud EP After Hours in 2012, which was re-released a year later on OVO Sound.

The pair made headlines under the new stage name “Majid Jordan” in late 2013 with a feature on Drake’s single “Hold On, We’re Going Home,” a collaboration that earned them a record deal with OVO Sound. The 2014 EP A Place Like This was the duo’s first release under OVO Sound. They released their self-titled debut album in 2016.

On October 27, 2017, the duo released their sophomore album The Space Between, which features label mates PARTYNEXTDOOR and dvsn..

On October 22 2021, the group released their third full length project, Wildest Dreams, which includes features from Drake, Swae Lee and Diddy.

Majid Jordan is an electronic-PBR&B duo formed in 2012 in Toronto, Canada, consisting of singer Majid Al Maskati and producer Jordan Ullman. Their music combines romantic R&B melodies with dance-able electronic beats.

Majid (originally from Bahrain) and Jordan (a Toronto native) met at the University of Toronto in 2011. They worked together under the stage name “Good People” and released the Soundcloud EP After Hours in 2012, which was re-released a year later on OVO Sound.

The pair made headlines under the new stage name “Majid Jordan” in late 2013 with a feature on Drake’s single “Hold On, We’re Going Home,” a collaboration that earned them a record deal with OVO Sound. The 2014 EP A Place Like This was the duo’s first release under OVO Sound. They released their self-titled debut album in 2016.

On October 27, 2017, the duo released their sophomore album The Space Between, which features label mates PARTYNEXTDOOR and dvsn..

On October 22 2021, the group released their third full length project, Wildest Dreams, which includes features from Drake, Swae Lee and Diddy.

songs.title: Her

description.plain:
“Her” is a smooth electronic-R&B jam about a relationship that initially wasn’t on smooth sailing. However, like the song’s production, the narrative almost instantly became smooth again.

The song is the third track on Majid Jordan’s 2014 EP A Place Like This, which takes the basic story arc of a relationship failing. Halfway through the EP with this song, the relationship seems fairly steady, but the beginning of the end comes with “U”, the fourth track.

songs.embed_content: Read “Her” by Majid Jordan on Genius

body.plain:
“Her” is a smooth electronic-R&B jam about a relationship that initially wasn’t on smooth sailing. However, like the song’s production, the narrative almost instantly became smooth again.

The song is the third track on Majid Jordan’s 2014 EP A Place Like This, which takes the basic story arc of a relationship failing. Halfway through the EP with this song, the relationship seems fairly steady, but the beginning of the end comes with “U”, the fourth track.

songs.lyrics:
30 ContributorsHer Lyrics[Chorus]
I got her, in the palm of, my hand
She knows I love her
I got her, thought I lost her, again

[Verse 1]
But life's so quick, sometimes
Just blinking you might miss it when you close, your eyes
It's been, a while, since we kicked it but the answer's on her lips tonight
[Chorus]
I got her, in the palm of, my hand
She knows I love her
I got her, thought I lost her, again

[Verse 2]
I'm on, the way
To finding out exactly how to treat her right
Another day, and I've been waiting
But I've been waiting my whole life, to find
Someone like her
[Chorus]
I got her, in the palm of, my hand
She knows I love her
I got her, thought I lost her, again
You might also like[Verse 3]
I'm glad we made it this far
Sometimes you just don't know
So many days spent apart but now
I'm finally yours (so won't you)

[Bridge]
Move my body, do it right
Left, right, side, side
Not about to waste my time, waiting all night
Move my body, do it right
Left, right, side, side
Not about to waste my time, waiting all night
[Chorus]
I got her, in the palm of, my hand
She knows I love her
I got her, thought I lost her, again
[Outro]
She knows I got her
She knows I love her
She knows I got her
She knows I love her
She knows, she does
But it's cool because
It's me she loves
She knows, she does102Embed

songs.full_title: My Love by Majid Jordan (Ft. Drake)
songs.title: My Love

description.plain:
Premiered on Beats 1 Radio, “My Love” is Majid Jordan’s first single following the release of their 2014 EP A Place Like This, and features label boss Drake. It came only a day after uploading a 20 minute mix on their Soundcloud.

During an annotation session with Genius, Majid Al Maskati from Majid Jordan explained how this track picks up where their first Drake collaboration (“Hold On, We’re Going Home”) left off:


“My Love” is an idea that was a reverse “Hold On, We’re Going Home” moment, in the sense that it was a collaboration with Drake again, but this time it was on our record.

We were looking for common ground for us to come together and talk about something that we could both relate to.

The song is about when you’re unsure about something, and the unease that comes with being unsure about somebody’s intentions, and if they’re being honest or not.


Producer Jordan Ullman explained how the song’s beat originated with producers Illangelo and Nineteen85:


This was a beat that Illangelo and Nineteen85 started first and gave it to me. I just added a little more energy into the bridge, and added different elements.

I like that beat because it just has this energy but it doesn’t really feel like a dance record. It’s a crossover record— it could be R&B, it could be dance, it could be looked at and perceived in many different ways.

songs.embed_content: Read “My Love” by Majid Jordan on Genius
